content.question: Based on current trends and patterns, which of the following statements best predicts how the human population will change over the next 50 years?

choices.label: As the amount of available food and drinking water increases, the population size will also increase.
As the population density increases, there will be an increase in disease transmission, leading to increased mortality.
A decrease in the number and magnitude of earthquakes and tsunamis will decrease the amount of land available for agriculture, leading to decreased fecundity.
As educational and economic opportunities increase for women in less developed countries, both the total fertility rate and the population size will increase.

content.answer: As the population density increases, there will be an increase in disease transmission, leading to increased mortality.
